intro: Vieusseuxia aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its vibrant orange, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
